overview:
Parent tags are used to expand an external template into the current template,
with optional parameters delimited by block tags.

These tags' content MUST be a non-whitespace character sequence NOT containing
the current closing delimiter; each Parent tag MUST be followed by an End
Section tag with the same content within the matching parent tag.

Block tags are used inside of parent tags to assign data onto the context stack 
prior to rendering the parent template. Outside of parent tags, block tags are
used to indicate where value set in the parent tag should be placed. If no value
is set then the content in between the block tags, if any, is rendered.

tests.desc: Default content renders triple mustache variables

tests.desc: Default content renders sections

tests.desc: Default content renders negative sections

tests.desc: Mustache injection in default content

tests.name: Inherit
tests.desc: Default content rendered inside included templates

tests.name: Overridden content
tests.desc: Overridden content

tests.name: Data does not override block
tests.desc: Provided data does not override data passed into parent

tests.name: Data does not override block default
tests.desc: Provided data does not override default value of block

tests.name: Overridden partial
tests.desc: Overridden partial

tests.desc: Two overridden partials with different content

tests.desc: Override partial with newlines

tests.desc: Override one substitution but not the other

tests.name: Super template
tests.desc: Super templates behave identically to partials when called with no parameters

tests.name: Recursion
tests.desc: Recursion in inherited templates

tests.name: Multi-level inheritance
tests.desc: Top-level substitutions take precedence in multi-level inheritance

tests.desc: Top-level substitutions take precedence in multi-level inheritance

tests.name: Text inside super
tests.desc: Ignores text inside super templates, but does parse $ tags

tests.name: Text inside super
tests.desc: Allows text inside a super tag, but ignores it
